Description: Heavily corroded copper alloy circular lid, with a short cylindrical edge, a shallow circular step on the surface and a central omega-shaped handle.
Curator's comments: "Large bronze lid", "found in the camp" with a "bronze bowl 7 1/2 inches across and 2 inches deep (pl. xli [read xxxix],17)" and a dipper (trua) 17 inches long, mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 77 § 76, pl. xxxix, 23. The bowl might be Boston MFA, 87.497, and the dipper Boston, MFA, 87.496b. The bowls of same shape Boston, MFA, Eg.Inv. 198 and Eg.Inv. 201, considered as possibly coming from Tell Dafana, have in fact little chance to have the same provenance.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 77 § 76, pl. xxxix, 23)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.42, p.52, fig.1, p.173, pl.15)
Condition: poor, partly restored on the edge
